items.message:
River levels have risen at the Brokenborough river gauge as a result of persistent heavy rainfall. Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible between 11:30 and into tomorrow, 10/05/23. We expect flooding to affect the road at Reybridge.   
We expect river levels to remain high until 11/05/23.
We are closely monitoring the situation. Our incident response staff are clearing weed screens and closing flood gates.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses and plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers which may be flooded and refer to local authority website for local road closures.  
This message will be updated Wednesday, 10/05/23, or as the situation changes.

items.message:
Flooding is possible in this area.

Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one.

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

Heavy showers are forecast and possible today; standing water and debris may still remain.
We will continue to work with emergency services and local authorities and to keep closely monitoring the situation.
There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain or be pumped away. Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.

items.eaAreaName: Devon, Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly

items.message: This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold. There are further heavy isolated showers forecast for today, Thursday 11 May 2023. We recommend that you avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses as there may still be standing water in some locations. We will continue to monitor the river level and observe weather forecasts, and we will issue a new flood message if needed. We recommend that you remain aware of the forecast for the next 5 days.

items.description: The Rivers Blyth and Walpole and Chediston, Bramfield and Wrentham watercourses
items.message: Levels are now well below the flood risk thresholds.  The forecast today is for random convective showers which may cause some localised rivers to react.  There may still be some areas where flood water is present until it can naturally drain away.  Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths, and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger.  We will continue to monitor levels closely.

This Flood Alert has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.
There are further heavy isolated showers forecast for today, Thursday 11 May 2023.
We recommend that you avoid using low lying footpaths near local watercourses as there may still be standing water in some locations. 
We will continue to monitor the river level and observe weather forecasts, and we will issue a new flood message if needed. We recommend that you remain aware of the forecast for the next 5 days.
